2.entity_description: Bird species collectively, a group of animals that play multiple ecological roles in ecosystems worldwide, including seed dispersal, natural pest control, pollination, nutrient cycling, and environmental monitoring.
2.resolution_context: All mentions refer to birds collectively as a group of species playing similar ecological roles (seed dispersal, pest control, etc.) in the same context, differing only in wording and granularity.

2.entity_description: Ecosystem service in which birds biologically control pest species by feeding on them, reducing pest populations and contributing to ecosystem stability.
2.resolution_context: All three mentions describe the same bird-mediated reduction of pest populations as a beneficial ecological role, differing only in phrasing and granularity, so they should be represented as a single ecosystem service entity.

2.entity_description: Groups of insects in ecosystems that are controlled naturally through bird predation.
2.resolution_context: In addition to seed dispersal, birds also play a key role in controlling insect populations. Many bird species feed on insects, serving as natural pest control agents that help keep insect populations in check.
